When Prince Llewellyn walked through the door, Gelert was waiting for him with blood on his body. Llewellyn ran into his son's bedroom. It was empty. The Prince took his sword(剑) and stabbed (刺向) the dog. Gelert looked at his master as if he didn't understand why.When Prince Llewellyn looked at his dead dog on the floor, he suddenly knew that he might had done something wrong. He looked around the room and saw that there had been a fight. Because there were clothes and broken dishes on the floor. There was a lot more blood, too. And then he heard the sound of a baby crying. The cry was coming from under the bed. There was his baby son, alive and well. On the floor behind the coat he saw the body of a dead wolf. And then the Prince realized Gelert hadn't killed his son—he had hidden the baby and killed the wolf. Prince Llewellyn was heartbroken. He organized a great ceremony to bury the dog that had saved his son's life. He visited the grave(坟墓) every day until he died.作答类型为T/F(对/错) 1. 吉尔特是王子卢埃林的狗。 2. 正是空荡荡的院子让卢埃林误会了吉尔特。 3. 事实上，卢埃林的儿子由母亲照顾。 4. 从这篇文章中，我们可以知道吉尔特非常善良和勇敢。 5. 在发现真相之前，我们应该保持冷静，不要做出错误的决定。
ques_analyze: 这是一篇关于王子和他忠诚狗吉尔特的记叙文。文章通过讲述王子外出打猎时，回到家发现血迹斑斑的狗和空无一人的婴儿卧室，误以为狗杀死了自己的孩子，因而杀死了狗，随后发现了真相的情节，来展现主题。具体分析如下：1. 细节理解题。根据文章中的描述'忠诚的狗吉尔特'，明确说明了吉尔特是王子卢埃林的狗，给出的陈述是正确的。2. 细节理解题。文章中卢埃林进入卧室发现空空如也，进而误解了吉尔特，不是院子。所以给出的陈述是错误的。3. 推理判断题。根据'吉尔特不是杀害他儿子的凶手，而是救了孩子的英雄'，告诉我们是吉尔特照顾着孩子并且杀死了狼，而非孩子的母亲，因此陈述是错误的。4. 推理判断题。根据吉尔特藏匿婴儿并且杀死狼的行为，我们可以判断吉尔特既善良又勇敢，因此这个陈述是正确的。5. 推理判断题。通过文章，我们知道在未发现真相前，卢埃林因为冲动做出了错误决定。这告诉我们做出决定前应保持冷静，不要冲动，所以这个陈述是正确的。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: There is an English saying, "Laughter is the best medicine. " Until recently, few people took the saying seriously. Now however, doctors have begun to study laughter and the influence it has on the human body. They have found that laughter can really improve people's health. Tests were carried out to study the influence of laughter on the body. People watched funny films while doctors checked their hearts , blood pressure, breathing and muscles. It was found that laughter has similar influence to physical exercise. It increases blood pressure, makes the heart beat quicker and makes people breathe deeper; it also works on several groups of muscles in the face, the stomach, and even the feet. If laughter exercises the body, it must be very helpful. Other tests have shown that laughter seems to be able to reduce the influence of pain on the body. In one experiment doctors produced pain in groups of students who listened to different radio programs. The group that stood the pain for the longest time was the group that listened to a funny program. The reason why laughter can reduce pain seems to be that it helps to produce a kind of chemical in the brain that makes both stress and pain less. As a result of these discoveries, some doctors in the United States now hold laughter clinics （诊所） , in which they help to improve their patients' condition by encouraging them to laugh. They have found that even if their patients do not really feel like laughing, making them smile is enough to produce useful influence. 作答类型为T/F(对/错) 1. 很多人认真对待“笑是最好的良药”这句话。 2. 笑声对身体的影响和体育锻炼一样。 3. 似乎没有听搞笑节目的一组人可以忍受更长时间的疼痛。 4. 大脑可以产生一种化学物质来减轻压力和疼痛。 5. 一些医生鼓励病人笑以改善他们的病情。
ques_analyze: 1. 根据文章的开头部分，直到最近很少有人认真对待‘笑是最好的良药’这句话，所以第一个陈述是错误的。2. 文章提到笑声的影响与体育锻炼相似，因此这个陈述是正确的。3. 实验表明，听搞笑节目的组忍受疼痛的时间最长，因此第三个陈述是错误的。4. 笑声能减轻疼痛是因为它帮助大脑产生一种化学物质，减轻压力和疼痛，所以这个陈述是正确的。5. 文章提到一些医生通过鼓励病人笑来改善病情，这个陈述是正确的。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: In choosing a friend, one should be very careful. A good friend can help you study. You can have fun together and make each other happy. Sometimes you will meet fair weather friends. They will be with you as long as you have money or luck, but when you are down, they will run away. How do I know when I have found a good friend? I look for certain qualities of character, especially understanding, honesty and reliability (可靠). Above all else, I look for understanding in a friend. A good friend tries to understand how another person is feeling. He is not quick to judge. Instead, he tries to learn from others. He puts himself in the other person's place, and he tries to think of ways to be helpful. He is also a good listener. At the same time, however, a good friend is honest. He does not look for faults (过错) in others. He notices their good points. In short, a friend will try to understand me and accept me. Another quality of a friend is reliability. I can always depend on a good friend. If he tells me he will meet me somewhere at a certain time, I can be sure that he will be there. If I need a favor, he will do his best to help me. If I am in trouble, he will not run away from me. When I meet someone who is reliable, honest, and understanding, I know I've found a friend! 作答类型为T/F(对/错) 1. 作者认为诚实是选择朋友时最重要的品质。  2. 如果你有酒肉朋友，当你遇到困难时，他们会远离你。  3. 好朋友需要时常指出彼此的错误。  4. 好朋友会努力理解他人的感受并不会轻易评判。  5. 这篇文章主要讨论了朋友应具备的品质。
ques_analyze:
1. 根据文章内容，作者重视理解力、诚实和可靠性，虽然这些都是重要的品质，但作者并没有强调诚实是最重要的。因此第一题答案为'B'，错误。
2. 文章提到的酒肉朋友是指那些只在你顺利时陪伴你的人，当你遇到困难时，他们会离开你。因此，第二题答案是'A'，正确。
3. 文章中明确指出'一个好朋友不会刻意挑剔别人的缺点'，所以第三题答案为'B'，错误。
4. 文章中提到'一个好朋友会努力理解他人的感受，不会轻易评判'，因此第四题答案是'A'，正确。
5. 文章的主题是讨论朋友应具备的品质，这与题干陈述一致，所以第五题答案是'A'，正确。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: 读下面的短文，根据短文内容判断句子的正误。正确的涂“A”，错误的涂“B”。 In Chiang Mai, there is a museum, it was decorated with beautiful marble tiles(大理石砖) and a huge marble statue(大理石雕像). Although the museum is a little far away from the city center of Chiang Mai, many people come here and admire the statue. One night, after all the tourists left, marble tiles started talking to the marble statue. Tiles: Hi, statue. Don’t you think it’s unfair that everybody comes here to admire you while stepping on us? Statue: Dear brothers, don’t you remember that we are actually from the same place? Tiles: Yes, we do. That is why we feel it is even more unfair. All of us were born from the same place, and yet the world treats us so coldly now. That is unfair! Statue: Yes, you are right, my brothers. But do you still remember the day when the artist tried to work on you, but you said no to him? Tiles: Yes, we refused him because we didn’t want to get hurt. Statue: Well, since you refused his tools, he couldn’t work on you. Then he started working on me instead. I knew that I would be something different and special after his hard work. I bore all the pain and allowed him to carve me! Tiles: But it hurt quite a lot! Statue: That’s for sure. Since you decided to give up halfway, you can’t complain about the world’s unfairness to you. 作答类型为T/F(对/错) 1. The story happened in the city center of Chiang Mai, Thailand. __  2. The marble tiles complained because they didn’t get as much admiration as the statue. __  3. According to the article, the marble statue might experience that it was hurt a lot, but never complained. __  4. The underlined word in the 7th paragraph ‘carve’ means “伤害”. __  5. According to the passage, although you give up halfway, you can still be successful. __
ques_analyze: 这篇文章通过大理石砖和大理石雕像之间的对话传达了一个道理：只有承受了艰难和痛苦，坚持到底的人，才能获得别人的赞赏和成功。 1. 题目说故事发生在市中心，但根据文中信息，博物馆离市中心较远，错误，所以答案是'B'。 2. 大理石砖抱怨是因为它们没有像雕像那样被人赞赏，文中有直接信息支持，所以答案是'A'。 3. 大理石雕像经历了很多痛苦，但它选择承受这些痛苦以实现成为众人景仰的雕像，对痛苦没有抱怨，所以答案是'A'。 4. ‘雕刻’在文中指的是艺术家将大理石雕刻成雕像，意味着'雕刻'而非'伤害'，所以答案是'B'。 5. 最后，题目旨在传达如果选择半途而废，就不能抱怨别人成功时世界的不公平，因此如果放弃，就不应期待成功，所以答案是'B'。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Do you have the experience of taking music lessons against your wishes? Perhaps you have complained about it because you thought it took you much playtime. But now you'd better thank your parents for their time and money spent on your musical training. A recent study suggests music lessons can make children have better memories than their peers. The Canadian study showed that after one year of musical training, children did better on a memory test than those who didn't take music lessons. The researchers made the children aged between 4 and 6 into two groups—one group of children took music lessons outside school, and the other didn't take any musical training. In one year, they took four tests at different times. The results showed brain development changes at least every four months. The children taking music lessons not only did better in musical listening but also made faster progress in other ways, such as reading, writing, math, and IQ. People say music is the good medicine for a broken heart. Now it seems music can also help us to improve our memories. We are sure to find more and more in the wonderful world of music. 作答类型为T/F(对/错) 1. 音乐可以帮助你提高记忆力。 2. 经过两年的音乐训练，孩子们在记忆测试中的表现更好。 3. 研究人员让一组4到6岁的孩子接受了一年的音乐训练。 4. 加拿大的研究表明，每四个月大脑的发展至少有一次变化。 5. 根据最后一段，大多数人认为音乐可以使我们自信。
ques_analyze: 本文主要讲述了音乐课对孩子记忆力的影响。1. 音乐可以帮你提高记忆力。这是通过加拿大的研究证明的，研究结果表明经过一年的音乐训练，孩子们在记忆测试中的表现比未参加音乐课程的孩子更好。2. 研究中提到的是一年的音乐训练，并非两年，所以第二题的表述是错误的。3. 研究者将4到6岁的孩子分成两组，其中一组在校外参加了音乐课程。4. 研究表明，每四个月大脑的发展至少会发生一次变化。5. 最后一段提到了音乐是治疗心碎的良药，能够帮助改善记忆力，并没有提到增强自信，因此第五题的陈述是错误的。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容:  One rainy day a woman with a dog got on the bus. It was a big dog and its feet were very dirty. The woman sat down and the dog stood near her. When the conductor ( 售票员) came up to her, she said, “Oh, conductor, I want to buy a ticket for my dog, can he have a seat like the other passengers?” The conductor looked at the dog and its dirty feet and then he said, “Of course, madam. He can have a seat like all the other passengers, but like all the other passengers, he must not put his feet on it.” 阅读短文，判断正（T）误（F）。作答类型为T/F(对/错) 1. 一个雨天，一个带着狗的女人上了公交车。 2. 那不是一只小狗，而且它的脚很脏。 3. 这个女人想给狗买张票。 4. 乘客必须把脚放在座位上。 5. 这只狗可以有一个座位。
ques_analyze: 【解析】1. 根据短文中的'一个雨天，一个带着狗的女人上了公交车'， 可以判定第1小题答案为T。2. 文中明确表示那是一只“大狗”，且“它的脚非常脏”， 所以第2小题答案应为T。3. 根据文章内容，女人对售票员说'我想给我的狗买张票’， 这清楚地支持了第3小题的答案T。4. 根据售票员的对话内容'他不能把脚放在座位上’ ，第4小题答案应为F，因为乘客的脚不能放在座位上。5. 尽管售票员允许狗上车，但根据'他不能把脚放在座位上'，这意味着狗不能做在座位上，从而第5小题答案为F。总结，该故事通过对话展现了车上的情景以及售票员对宠物乘坐要求的规定。【重点】对这类短文，需结合文中具体信息和细节以准确理解和判断。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: How do animals communicate (交流) with each other? They have special “languages”. In fact, they are using signals (信号). Different signals have different meanings. For example, when a bee (蜜蜂) finds food somewhere, it flies home quickly. It can’t speak, but it can tell others by dancing. Other bees will know where and how far the food is. Some animals show their feelings by making sounds. For example, when a dog is angry, it barks (吠). At this time, you’d better stay away from it. Birds can make several sounds to show different meanings. Sometimes we humans show feelings by making sounds instead of by speaking. For example, when we feel painful (疼痛的), we cry “Oh!” or “Ouch!”. We humans have languages and words. We can communicate face to face by speaking. We can write down what happened in order to remember clearly. We can also send (寄) messages to people far away. But animals can’t. 根据短文内容，判断正（T）误（F）。 作答类型为T/F(对/错)。 1. Humans and animals both have their own languages. 2. A bee can tell others the messages by singing songs. 3. Birds can make different sounds to show different meanings. 4. All the animals can communicate with others far away. 5. When a dog is not happy, you’d better keep away from it.
ques_analyze: 本文讨论了人类和动物的交流方式。第一点提到人类和动物都有各自的语言，故第1题为T。第二点明确说明蜜蜂是通过跳舞而非唱歌传递信息，因此第2题为F。第三点指出鸟类可以通过发出不同的声音来表达不同的意思，所以第3题为T。第四点提到虽然人类可以传递远距离信息，但动物不能，因此第4题为F。第五点描述狗生气时会吠叫，建议此时远离它，因此第5题为T。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: When the world was young, people only lived in warm places because they didn't know how to keep themselves warm in cold environments. At first, people didn't know how to make a fire. They just discovered by chance that when lightning struck trees, it created fire. So, they took the fire back to their homes and used it whenever they wanted. Fire was very important to humans, not only for warmth but also for driving away wild animals, and cooked food tasted better. However, early humans couldn't make fire themselves, so they cherished it greatly. If the fire went out, they could only wait for the next lightning to start a new fire, which might take years. 作答类型为T/F(对/错) 1. 很久以前，人们只生活在温暖的地方。 2. 人们不住在寒冷的地方是因为野兽太多。 3. 早期的人们知道如何保持火焰不熄灭。 4. 他们也知道如何生火。 5. 如果火熄灭了，他们需要靠偶然再次获得火焰。
ques_analyze: 首先，我们知道在远古时代，人类只能生活在温暖的地区，因为他们无法在寒冷的环境中保暖，所以题目中的第一句（人们只生活在温暖的地方）是正确的。对于第二句，文章明确说明人们不居住在寒冷的地方是因为他们不知道如何取暖，而非野兽的原因，因此第二句是错误的。接着，早期人类确实知道如何保持火焰持续燃烧，所以第三句是正确的。但是，文章也指出人类并不具备自己生火的能力，这表明第四句（他们知道如何生火）是错误的。最后，如果火焰熄灭，他们只能等待自然界的闪电再次引发火灾，所以第五句是正确的。综上所述，这些问题的答案都准确反映了文章内容，并且解析了早期人类与火的关系及其对生存的重要性。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: 阅读理解．Joanna is a 26﹣year﹣old woman． She has to clean and care her hair five times a day． And she uses two bottles of hair conditioner（护发素）a day． So her hair is very strong． She can pull a car with her hair． And the weight of the car is 2.5 tons! She holds the Guinness（吉尼斯）World Record． "It\'s so exciting，" says Joanna． 作答类型为T/F（对/错） 1. Joanna 是26岁。 2. Joanna 每天使用五瓶护发素。 3. 护发素能让Joanna的头发变得不好。 4. Joanna 能用头发拉动汽车。 5. 汽车的重量是2.5吨。
ques_analyze: 根据题目所提供的信息，本文描述了Joanna的一些情况，重点在于她头发的独特之处。首先，根据文中信息‘Joanna 是一位26岁的女士’，我们可以判断年龄这一细节，所以第一个判断是正确的。再看第二题，文中指出‘她每天使用两瓶护发素’，与题目描述的每天使用五瓶护发素不符，因此答案是错误的。第三题中，‘因此，她的头发非常结实’说明护发素起到了积极作用，而不是让头发变差，因此这一判断也是错误的。第四题提到，‘她可以用头发拉动一辆重达2.5吨的汽车’，这正证明了题目叙述的正确性。对于第五题，通过比对文中的‘重达2.5吨的汽车’，可以确认陈述是正确的。通过这些细节理解题的精确分析，我们可以得出最终的答案。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content:
题目内容: Have you ever heard of a girl of 15, who set up a company of her own? Wendy Wong is the girl. She started the business two years ago and has already written several successful computer games. They are so popular that over half a million games are sold every year. Now all her family work in her company, and she is still at school. She gets up early in the morning, and then she talks with her family about the business over breakfast. Every day she goes to school with a driver, for she is not old enough to drive. She enjoys her school, but some of the work is too easy for her to feel interested. She usually gets "A" grades in all her subjects, so the other students often ask for help. She finishes her homework in half an hour after her driver takes her home. After dinner, she goes to her office and continues working on her computer, writing games until 2 a.m. She does not usually need as much sleep as other children.

作答类型为T/F(对/错)

2. Wendy Wong的电脑游戏非常受欢迎。

4. Wendy Wong对所有课程都很感兴趣。

ques_analyze: 短文介绍了Wendy Wong在15岁时创立了自己的公司，而不是18岁，所以第1题是错误的。
文中明确提到Wendy的电脑游戏每年销售超过五十万份，证明了它们非常受欢迎，因此第2题是正确的。
文中提到Wendy由司机送她上学，而不是她的父亲，所以第3题是错误的。
尽管Wendy在所有科目上都取得了A的成绩，但有些课程对她来说太简单了，因此她并不是对所有课程都感兴趣，所以第4题是错误的。
Wendy在放学后只需半小时就能完成作业，而不是一个小时，所以第5题是错误的。
